description: Time point for a schedule where the time between the consecutive points is constant.

contents.name: IntervalSchedule
contents.description: Regular interval schedule containing this time point.

contents.name: sequenceNumber
contents.description: The position of the regular time point in the sequence. Note that time points don't have to be sequential, i.e. time points may be omitted. The actual time for a RegularTimePoint is computed by multiplying the associated regular interval schedule's time step with the regular time point sequence number and adding the associated schedules start time.

contents.name: value1
contents.description: The first value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule.

contents.name: value2
contents.description: The second value at the time. The meaning of the value is defined by the derived type of the associated schedule.
